Key Match Events: Jose Altuve hit a game-winning double in the bottom of the ninth inning to secure a 3-2 walk-off win for the Astros.
Framber Valdez threw seven no-hit innings.
Paul DeJong hit a two-run homer in the top of the ninth to tie the game.
Josh Hader's consecutive saves streak was snapped at 29 games.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Joe Espada praised Jose Altuve's ability to deliver in crucial moments.
Espada reflected on Framber Valdez's performance, highlighting his efficiency and composure.
Espada commented on Josh Hader's blown save, acknowledging his overall outstanding performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have had five no-hit bids of at least seven innings this year, tying the 1989 Rangers and 1965 Reds for the most in one season in the expansion era.
